techniques.name: Basic Combos 6-10
techniques.description: Extension of the basic boxing combinations within the CSA striking system, focusing on advanced combinations that incorporate uppercuts and alternate between hook and cross punches for dynamic striking patterns.

strategies.diversification: Introduces uppercuts and varying patterns of hooks and crosses to disrupt opponents' defenses and create openings.
strategies.adaptation: Combos are adaptable, allowing for strategic modifications based on opponent's stance and responses.
strategies.expansion: While rooted in boxing, these combos provide a foundation for integration with Muay Thai techniques for enhanced combat effectiveness.

techniques.description: A powerful three-strike combination focusing on alternating between straight and curved punches to penetrate defenses.
An extension of the previous combo with an additional hook to maintain offensive pressure and target the sides.
Starts with an uppercut to lift the guard followed by a hook and cross to exploit opened defenses.
Begins with a lead uppercut, setting up for a cross and hook to attack from varying angles.
Focuses on penetrating straight attacks with an uppercut in the middle to disrupt the opponent's guard.

strategies.counter-preparation: Emphasizes the importance of ending combinations in positions that minimize vulnerability to counters.
strategies.guard manipulation: Utilizes combinations to manipulate the opponent's guard, creating opportunities for follow-up attacks.

defensive.notes: The execution of these combinations requires attention to defensive posture to ensure the fighter remains protected against counters.

key_points: Combos 6-10 build upon the foundational boxing techniques with more complex patterns for advanced fighters.
Incorporation of uppercuts introduces verticality in striking, offering new angles of attack.
Strategic guard manipulation through these combos can open significant opportunities for damage.
